verses.roman:
anāṁsy anaḍud-yuktāni
te cāruhya sv-alaṅkṛtāḥ
gopyaś ca kṛṣṇa-vīryāṇi
gāyantyaḥ sa-dvijāśiṣaḥ

synonyms: anāṁsi—wagons; anaḍut-yuktāni—yoked with oxen; te—they; ca—and; āruhya—riding; su-alaṅkṛtāḥ—nicely ornamented; gopyaḥ—the cowherd women; ca—and; kṛṣṇa-vīryāṇi—the glories of Lord Kṛṣṇa; gāyantyaḥ—singing; sa—together with; dvija—of the brāhmaṇas; āśiṣaḥ—the benedictions.
translation: As the beautifully ornamented cowherd ladies followed along, riding on wagons drawn by oxen, they sang the glories of Lord Kṛṣṇa, and their songs mingled with the brāhmaṇas' chanting of benedictions.
